content: sweet oddity art shila the unicorn crochet pattern https //www etsy com/shop/sweetoddityart copyright 2022 of sweet oddity art you are not allowed to sell this pattern you are not allowed to distribute or publish this pattern in any form you are not allowed to alter this pattern in any form sweet oddity art 1 pattern details size 15 inches from bottom to top of head with weight 6 yarn and a 3 75 mm hook skill level needed intermediate- suitable for novice crocheters requires patience and precision when assembling the unicorn and basic crochet skills contact info if you have any questions or concerns about this pattern please do not hesitate to contact me i will get back to you within 24 hours sweetoddityart@gmail com https //www etsy com/shop/sweetoddityart materials needed yarn chenille yarn weight #6 or bulky worsted weight yarn #4 color a gray color b purple color c blue color d worsted color hook size f hook or 3 75 mm d hook or 3 25 mm 21 mm safety eyes scissors sewing needle stitch marker fiberfill stuffing false eyelashes abbreviations magic_ring= magic_ring- crochet single_crochet stitches in to the adjustable loop blo= back loops only chain= chain stitch f/o= fasten_off single_crochet= single_crochet stitch half_double_crochet= half_double_crochet sl= slip_stitch flo= front loops only double_crochet= double_crochet stitch inc3= 3 single_crochet in the same stitch bob st= bobble stitch increase= increase- make two single_crochet stitches in the same stitch decrease=decrease- crochet two stitches together using the decrease method 4 single_crochet increase x 6= repeat the pattern between parentheses 6 times notes do not join rounds unless stated work in a continuous spiral use a stitch marker to mark the beginning of each round all stitches are worked in both loops unless stated otherwise in the pattern sweet oddity art 2 head crocheted from top of head to bottom with color a chain 6 1 increase in 2nd chain from hook 3 single_crochet inc3 in last chain working on opposite side of chain 4 single_crochet= 12 for help working on the opposite side of the chain refer to pg 14 2 increase x 2 3 single_crochet increase x 3 3 single_crochet increase= 18 3 single_crochet increase x 2 3 single_crochet single_crochet increase x 3 4 single_crochet increase= 24 4 2 single_crochet increase x 2 3 single_crochet 2 single_crochet increase x 3 5 single_crochet increase= 30 5 single_crochet in each st around 6 4 single_crochet increase x 6= 36 7-9 single_crochet in each st around *in round 10 mark the 3rd increase of each set of increases this is for eye placement* 10 3 single_crochet increase x 6 6 single_crochet increase x 6 15 single_crochet= 48 place eyes between rounds 8 and 9 leaving 10 holes between them place them above the stitch markers look to pictures on pg 4 for reference if you want the sunken eye look do not place the backs of the eyes on until round 15 11-12 single_crochet in each st around 13 6 single_crochet decrease x 3 12
